decks.notes: The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a mix of creature removal and disruption spells. It includes powerful creatures like Preacher of the Schism and Deep-Cavern Bat to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. In addition, it utilizes cards like Go for the Throat and Shoot the Sheriff to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Liliana of the Veil and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal adds versatility to the deck. Overall, the Orzhov Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly while maintaining control of the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells in order to deal damage as quickly as possible. By playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Emberheart Challenger, along with pump spells like Giant Growth and Monstrous Rage, you can effectively push through damage and secure victories. The inclusion of cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Audacity allow for additional reach and surprise bursts of damage. Overall, this deck aims to be fast and relentless in its assault on your opponent.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent using a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on efficiently removing threats with cards like Go for the Throat, Disfigure, and Gix's Command while simultaneously developing a strong board presence with creatures like Mosswood Dreadknight, Deep-Cavern Bat, and Glissa Sunslayer. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil adds another dimension to the deck's strategy, allowing for both creature disruption and card advantage.

The main concept of this Golgari Control deck is to use a combination of removal spells, creature control, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Vraska, Betrayal's Sting to dominate the battlefield and disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck focuses on efficiently removing threats with cards like Go for the Throat and Tear Asunder, while also deploying resilient threats like Mosswood Dreadknight and Glissa Sunslayer to apply pressure. By controlling the board and out-valuing your opponent, you can grind out a win through attrition and resource management.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent while also disrupting their hand with cards like Overwhelming Remorse. The deck also includes cards that help generate value such as Seed of Hope and Souls of the Lost. With a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, forcing the opponent to react to its threats or risk falling behind.

The main idea of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By using efficient creatures like Manifold Mouse and Emberheart Challenger, alongside combat tricks such as Monstrous Rage and Shock, the deck aims to deal early damage and maintain pressure throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Witchstalker Frenzy and Restless Ridgeline provides additional value and resilience to the deck. Overall, this deck focuses on quick, powerful plays to outpace and defeat the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main idea of this Orzhov Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy using a combination of creatures and removal spells. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Preacher of the Schism and Deep-Cavern Bat, supported by spells like Cut Down and Go for the Throat to maintain board control. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption while cards like Virtue of Persistence and Virtue of Loyalty help pump up your creatures for extra damage. The inclusion of cards like Temporal Lockdown and Legions to Ashes can help clear the opponent's board for a final push with powerful finishers like Zoraline, Cosmos Caller and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal.

A fast-paced aggressive deck focused on dealing damage quickly to the opponent through a combination of creatures with strong attack power and direct damage spells. The strategy is to control the battlefield early on with efficient creatures and removal spells, while also maintaining pressure with consistent damage output. The deck features a mix of creatures with different abilities that complement each other, along with some versatile removal options to deal with threats. By efficiently utilizing its resources, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with a combination of various low-cost creatures and removal spells to quickly control the battlefield. It utilizes quick creature drops like Deep-Cavern Bat and Preacher of the Schism to pressure opponents early on, while also disrupting their game plan with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down. Additionally, cards like Virtue of Loyalty and Virtue of Persistence provide buffs to your creatures, allowing you to maintain board presence and overwhelm your opponent. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and control the game tempo to secure a quick victory.

The main idea of this Golgari Control deck is to utilize removal spells and disruptive cards to control the opponent's board while deploying resilient threats of its own. Cards like Go for the Throat, Duress, and Tear Asunder help deal with threats, while Glissa Sunslayer and Mosswood Dreadknight provide a strong presence on the battlefield. Vraska, Betrayal's Sting and Liliana of the Veil offer additional removal and card advantage, ensuring that the deck can outvalue the opponent over the course of the game. Restless Cottage and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal provide additional utility and resilience to the strategy.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on utilizing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It includes a mix of control cards like Go for the Throat and Duress to disrupt the opponent's strategy, along with aggressive creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Gix, Yawgmoth Praetor to deal damage quickly. The deck also features cards like Tishana's Tidebinder and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to provide additional utility and power on the battlefield. With a balance of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to take control early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on combining quick aggression with disruption to overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy is to play efficiently costed aggressive creatures such as Beza, the Bounding Spring and Deep-Cavern Bat, while also utilizing removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to control the board. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Aclazotz, Deepest Betrayal offer powerful late-game threats. The deck aims to close out the game quickly by applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's game plan.
